id.description: Unique ID of the item record

hrid.description: The human readable ID, also called eye readable ID. A system-assigned sequential alternate ID

volumeDesignation.description: Volume is intended for monographs when a multipart monograph (e.g. a biography of Gerorge Bernard Shaw in three volumes)

materialTypeId.description: Material type, term. Define what type of thing the item is.

copyNumber.description: Item/Piece ID (usually barcode) for systems that do not use item records. Ability to designate the copy number if institution chooses to use copy numbers.

discoverySuppress.description: Records the fact that the record should not be displayed in a discovery system

holdingsRecordId.description: ID of the holdings record the item is a member of.

effectiveLocationId.description: Read only current home location for the item.

effectiveCallNumberComponents.description: Elements of a full call number generated from the item or holding

callNumber.description: Effective Call Number is an identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

prefix.description: Effective Call Number Prefix is the prefix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

suffix.description: Effective Call Number Suffix is the suffix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

name.description: Name of the status e.g. Available, Checked out, In transit

date.description: Date and time when the status was last changed

permanentLoanTypeId.description: The permanent loan type, is the default loan type for a given item. Loan types are tenant-defined.

temporaryLoanTypeId.description: Temporary loan type, is the temporary loan type for a given item.

barcode.description: Unique inventory control number for physical resources, used largely for circulation purposes
